{"document_id": "Kaggle::techmap::61508887681fda47d1a15dcf::linkedin_us", "source": "linkedin_us", "country": "US", "company": "Greenbrier Academy for Girls", "position": "Greenbrier Academy for Girls hiring Head Chef Pence Springs, West Virginia, United States", "notes": "", "original": "
Greenbrier Academy for Girls is searching for a passionate and dependable full-time Head Chef/Cook to join our team. Located in Pence Springs, West Virginia, Greenbrier Academy for Girls is an all-girls therapeutic boarding school with students aged 14-18. Our students come from all over the world to receive exceptional education and therapeutic services.

Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding way to make a difference in the lives of young women and the community?

Do you want more than a job? Do you want purpose?

Essential Functions
  • Prepares healthy and delicious food in a timely and quality manner; prepares food on-site in batches for quantities that are sufficient for the needs of that site/school.
  • Performs food preparation tasks according to planned menus and schedule; cooks food, prepared or from scratch for student nutrition programs that meet the mandated nutritional needs; prepares and serves foods according to company dietary guidelines; and works with Silica gluten-free.
  • Create tasty and well-balanced menu options that highlight local ingredients, including seasons, marinates, cooks, tastes meats, fruits, vegetables, and other ingredients. Scales recipes to appropriate quantities need for the assigned site/school.
  • Perform food safety inspections to verify quantity, quality, and specifications of orders to meet preparation needs and comply with mandated health and food safety standards.
  • Cleans and maintains equipment and food preparation and storage areas in a sanitary condition to meet mandated health standards; reports equipment needs and malfunctions.
  • Plan and prepare food for special events such as parent workshops and education consultant visits, tours, and graduations.
  • Manage a documented food budget, kitchen inventory, and storage, including requisition and purchasing sufficient food for meals and snacks.
Necessary Knowledge
  • Federal, state, and local codes and regulations governing food handling and public nutrition services.
  • Safety and sanitation practices for food preparation, distribution, and storage.
  • Methods, materials, and practices of volume food preparation and inventory control.
Physical Demands and Working Environment

Work is performed in commercial foodservice and kitchen work environment; moderate physical requirements, with risk of burns and cuts; frequent lifting, carrying, and moving up to 50-pound containers of food preparation materials and equipment; may require working in a walk-in freezer.

Requirements
  • A High School Diploma or GED Certificate is required. A Culinary Arts Degree is preferred.
  • Two or more years of prior experience in food preparation for large groups is required.
  • A current Food Handler’s Permit is required.
  • Passing applicable state and/or federal criminal background checks are required.
  • Tuberculosis (TB) test is required.
  • Proof of legal permission to work in the United States is required.
COVID-19 precautions
  • Personal protective equipment provided or required
  • Temperature screenings
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place
Employment Type: Full Time

Years Experience: 3 - 5 years

Salary: $30,000 - $40,000 Annual

Bonus/Commission: No
